summary: This document is the official rules and regulations for inmates housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details daily routines, sanitation standards, permitted personal property, and privileges for inmates under administrative detention or disciplinary segregation. The document includes an acknowledgement form for inmates to sign.

persons.name: M. C. Ward
persons.context: Appears as the approving authority for the Special Housing Unit rules and regulations document.

events.title: Rules Revision
events.description: The Special Housing Unit rules and regulations document was revised.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, NY
keyFacts: The document outlines strict daily routines for SHU inmates, including specific times for bed-making, lights, and recreation.
Inmate privileges such as phone calls, commissary, and visits are severely restricted compared to general population, especially for those in disciplinary segregation.
The rules detail authorized personal property, with different allowances for administrative detention versus disciplinary segregation status.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons form, revised in 2005 and approved by Captain M. C. Ward, and is not specific to any individual inmate like Jeffrey Epstein.
